description.narrative: Funding under this investment represents Australia’s contribution to the Multi-Donor Trust Fund of the Stolen Asset Recovery Initiative (StAR), a joint initiative of the World Bank and the United Nations Office and Drugs and Crime (UNODC). Asset recovery remains high on the global agenda and in addition to continued attention of the General Assembly of the United Nations, took a prominent place in the context of the new Sustainable Development Goals and of the Financing for Development discussions. StAR works with developing countries and financial centers to prevent the laundering of the proceeds of corruption and to facilitate more systematic and timely return of stolen assets. The total value of this investment is $1.5 million over 3 years, starting 2016-17.
